body:
It just occurred to me that in Windows, besides casing, one can use \\ or /, at will. So, these paths refer to the same file:

\\this\\is\\my\\file
/this/is/my/file
/this\\is/my\\file

Excuse me if that is a beaten topic and I am late to the discussion but maybe, instead of trusting in a plain string comparison or strings.EqualFold, what we need is a filepath function that, given two paths, returns true if they refer to the same file. In Unix that could be implemented with a simple string comparison, but in Windows it could have a more elaborated logic.
